intro: Ornithogalum autumnulum, commonly known as the autumn lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a bulbous stem that produces a cluster of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant blooms in late summer to early autumn, producing clusters of white or pale pink flowers with six tepals. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its elegant, bell-shaped flowers that attract pollinators.
